data.text:
Susan Saint James Net Worth: $60 million

Highlights

Susan Saint James is an accomplished actress and activist who has made significant contributions to the entertainment industry. With a net worth of $60 million, she has established herself as a successful artist over the years.

Early Life

Susan Saint James was born on August 14, 1946, in Los Angeles, California. She began her career in the fashion industry as a teenage model before pursuing acting. She attended the Connecticut College for Women, where she further honed her skills and passion for performing arts.

Career

Saint James made her debut in the entertainment industry with a role in the 1966 TV movie “Fame is the Name of the Game”. She then ventured into the big screen with her appearance in the 1968 movie “New Face in Hell”. Her talent and charisma led to various opportunities, and she went on to star in several notable television series.

From 1967 to 1968, she appeared in the TV series “Ironside,” followed by her role in “It Takes a Thief” from 1968 to 1970. One of her breakthrough roles came in the TV series “The Name of the Game” where she portrayed Peggy Maxwell from 1968 to 1971.

Saint James gained widespread recognition for her role as Sally McMillan in the series “McMillan & Wife,” which aired from 1971 to 1976. However, one of her most memorable and beloved characters was Kate McArdle in the TV series “Kate & Allie,” which ran from 1984 to 1989.

Throughout her career, Susan Saint James showcased her exceptional acting skills, receiving critical acclaim and numerous accolades. In 1969, she won a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Continued Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Series. Additionally, she received several Emmy and Golden Globe Award nominations for her remarkable performances.

Besides her acting career, Saint James actively engaged in philanthropic endeavors and advocacy work, displaying her commitment to various causes and making a positive impact on society.

Personal Life

In 1981, Susan Saint James married Dick Ebersol, an NBC executive. Tragically, their son Teddy passed away in a 2004 plane crash, which Ebersol and their son Charles survived. Despite this profound loss, Saint James and Ebersol have showcased immense strength and resilience in the face of adversity.

Net Worth Over Time

Susan Saint James has achieved remarkable success throughout her career, resulting in a substantial net worth of $60 million. As one of the most prominent actresses in the industry, she has amassed her wealth through her various television and film appearances, alongside endorsements and other business ventures.

Components of Net Worth

The factors contributing to Susan Saint James’ impressive net worth include her successful acting career, brand endorsements, and business investments. With her talent, dedication, and influential presence, she has secured a prosperous financial status, making her one of the wealthiest actresses in the industry.

Overall, Susan Saint James has left a lasting impact on the entertainment world, captivating audiences with her exceptional talent and becoming a respected figure in the industry. As a renowned actress and committed activist, her vast net worth of $60 million reflects her significant achievements and contributions throughout her illustrious career.
